note: Depending on the country and year, inequality data relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita).
title: Death rate from cancers vs. income inequality
subtitle: The death rate (measured as the number of deaths per 100,000 individuals) refers to all forms of cancers and is standardized for age to allow cross-country comparisons. The [Gini coefficient](#dod:gini) measures inequality on a scale from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate higher inequality.
